Keywords: empty list, no data, empty table, no items, no results
Description: When a list or table has no data to display. Show helpful message with action to create first item.
Do: Show illustration/icon + message + CTA button. Message format: 'No [items] yet' + 'Create your first [item] to get started'. Center vertically in the content area. Match app's visual style.
Don't: Don't show a blank white space. Don't show 'No data' without context. Don't show table headers with empty body. Don't forget the CTA to create first item.
Code Example Good:
No projects yet

Create your first project to start organizing your work
Code Example Bad: NameDate

Keywords: skeleton, placeholder, loading skeleton, content placeholder
Description: Placeholder UI that mimics the layout of content while it loads. Better than spinners for perceived performance.
Do: Match the exact layout of the final content. Use gray animated pulse bars for text lines. Use gray rectangles for images. Animate with pulse or shimmer effect. Show for 200-3000ms.
Don't: Don't show skeleton for more than 3 seconds (switch to error state). Don't make skeleton layout different from actual content. Don't use skeleton for small inline loaders (use spinner).
Code Example Bad: Loading...

Keywords: spinner, loading, progress, circular loader, activity indicator
Description: Spinning animation to indicate an operation is in progress. Used for button submissions, inline loading, page transitions.
Do: Use spinner inside the triggering element (button, card) when possible. Size: 16-20px for inline, 32-48px for page-level. Use brand color or neutral gray. Add sr-only text for accessibility.
Don't: Don't use full-page overlay spinner for small operations. Don't use spinner without context (what is loading?). Don't block entire UI for partial loads.

Keywords: error boundary, crash page, something went wrong, error fallback
Description: Fallback UI shown when a component or page crashes due to runtime error.
Do: Show friendly message: 'Something went wrong'. Include Retry button. Optionally show error details in collapsible section (for dev). Link to home page and support. Log error to monitoring service.
Don't: Don't show raw error stack trace to users. Don't leave user stuck with no way out. Don't lose user's work without offering recovery. Don't show generic browser error page.
Code Example Good:
Something went wrong

We encountered an unexpected error. Please try again or contact support if the problem persists.

Go Home
Code Example Bad: Error: Cannot read property 'map' of undefined

Keywords: 404, not found, page missing, broken link, dead link
Description: Custom 404 page shown when user visits a URL that doesn't exist.
Do: Show friendly message with personality (illustration, humor). Include: Search bar, Back to Home button, Popular pages links. Match site's design style. Don't blame the user.
Don't: Don't show default browser 404 page. Don't use only text 'Page not found'. Don't redirect to homepage automatically (let user choose). Don't show a broken layout.
Code Example Good:
404

Page not found

The page you're looking for doesn't exist or has been moved.

Go HomeContact Support
Code Example Bad:
404

Not Found

Keywords: 500, server error, internal error, system down, maintenance
Description: Custom 500 page for server errors. Reassure users the issue is temporary.
Do: Show apologetic message. Include estimated recovery time if known. Provide status page link. Include retry button and support contact. Auto-refresh option.
Don't: Don't show technical details (stack trace, server info). Don't blame the user. Don't leave user with no actions available. Don't forget to log the actual error server-side.
Code Example Good:
We're having technical difficulties

Our team has been notified and is working on a fix. Please try again in a few minutes.
Code Example Bad:
Internal Server Error

Error 500: ECONNREFUSED

Keywords: no results, search empty, nothing found, no matches
Description: When a search query returns zero results. Help user find what they're looking for.
Do: Show clear message: 'No results for [query]'. Suggest: Check spelling, Try different keywords, Browse categories. Show popular/trending items. Keep search bar visible and editable.
Don't: Don't show completely blank page. Don't lose the search query from input. Don't suggest results that don't match (misleading). Don't hide filters that might be restricting results.
Code Example Good:
No results for “query”

Try checking your spelling or using different keywords

Popular searches:

ReactNext.js

Keywords: onboarding, welcome, first use, getting started, new user
Description: When a new user first enters the app. Guide them through initial setup or show them around.
Do: Show welcome message with user's name. Provide a checklist of setup steps (3-5 items). Mark steps as complete. Show progress bar. Allow skipping. Highlight key features with tooltips or tour.
Don't: Don't overwhelm with too many steps (max 5). Don't block the app behind mandatory onboarding. Don't show onboarding on every login. Don't forget to track completion and hide when done.
Code Example Good:
Welcome, Sarah! ðŸ‘‹

Complete these steps to get the most out of your account
Code Example Bad: Welcome! Click around to explore.

Keywords: 403, forbidden, access denied, no permission, unauthorized
Description: When user tries to access a resource they don't have permission for.
Do: Show clear message about access restriction. Suggest requesting access or contacting admin. Provide navigation back to accessible areas. Don't reveal what's behind the restriction.
Don't: Don't show generic 'Access Denied' without context. Don't redirect silently. Don't show the restricted content partially. Don't expose information about the resource.
Code Example Good:
Access restricted

You don't have permission to view this page. Contact your administrator for access.

Go to DashboardRequest Access
Code Example Bad: 403 Forbidden

Keywords: progress, upload, download, file progress, step progress
Description: Linear progress indicator for operations with known completion percentage (file uploads, multi-step forms).
Do: Show percentage or step count. Use smooth animation for progress changes. Color: brand color for bar, gray for track. Height: 4-8px. Show below the triggering element or at top of page.
Don't: Don't use progress bar for unknown-duration operations (use spinner). Don't reset progress unexpectedly. Don't show fake progress (jumping from 0 to 90% instantly).
Code Example Good: Uploading document.pdf67%

Keywords: offline, no connection, network error, disconnected
Description: When user loses internet connection while using the app.
Do: Show banner or overlay indicating offline status. Keep cached content visible if possible. Disable actions that require network. Auto-reconnect and dismiss when back online.
Don't: Don't block entire app (show cached data). Don't show generic error page. Don't lose user's unsaved work. Don't forget to re-enable functionality on reconnect.
Code Example Good: You're offline. Some features may be unavailable.
Code Example Bad: No internet connection

Keywords: optimistic update, instant feedback, local update, pending state
Description: Show the result of an action immediately before server confirmation. Revert on failure.
Do: Apply changes to UI immediately on user action. Show subtle pending indicator (dimmed, pulse). Confirm with server in background. Revert with error message if server rejects. Works for: likes, saves, deletes, toggles.
Don't: Don't show loading spinner for actions that can be optimistic. Don't forget to handle server rejection (revert + error). Don't use for financial transactions or irreversible actions.
Code Example Bad: <button onclick="toggleLike()"><svg class="animate-spin">spinner</svg></button> <!-- Shows spinner for every like action, slow UX -->

Keywords: maintenance, scheduled downtime, system update, coming back
Description: When the app is undergoing planned maintenance. Inform users and provide timeline.
Do: Show estimated return time. Provide status page link. Allow email notification sign-up for when service resumes. Show maintenance reason briefly. Keep the page lightweight (no heavy assets).
Don't: Don't show a blank page. Don't forget to update the estimated time. Don't use this for unplanned outages (use 500 page). Don't block access to status page.
Code Example Good:
Scheduled Maintenance

We're upgrading our systems to serve you better. We'll be back by 3:00 PM UTC.

Check status page â†’
Code Example Bad: Down for maintenance

Keywords: stale data, outdated, last updated, cached data
Description: When displayed data might be outdated. Show when data was last refreshed and offer manual refresh.
Do: Show 'Last updated: X minutes ago' timestamp. Provide Refresh button. Auto-refresh in background on configurable interval. Show subtle indicator (not alarming) for stale data.
Don't: Don't silently show stale data without indication. Don't auto-refresh too aggressively (save bandwidth). Don't show 'Last updated: just now' permanently (update dynamically).
Code Example Good: Last updated 5 minutes ago
Code Example Bad: <!-- No indication that data might be stale, user sees numbers from 2 hours ago without knowing -->
